title: MPPI & MPC-Driven Control Framework for 4-Channel Fixed-Wing UAV
one_liner: Developing model-predictive and sample-efficient control frameworks for high-agility fixed-wing UAV navigation (ongoing)
team: Networked Control Systems Lab, Purdue University
problem: High-agility fixed-wing UAVs require advanced control strategies beyond classical PID for aggressive maneuvers
Balancing real-time performance with robustness under aerodynamic uncertainty and environmental disturbances is challenging
Controller designs must transfer effectively from simulation to real flight with minimal retuning
approach: Formulating Model Predictive Path Integral (MPPI) and Model Predictive Control (MPC) frameworks tailored to 4-channel fixed-wing dynamics
Designing cost functions and state constraints for aggressive pylon navigation and energy-efficient flight
Leveraging high-fidelity simulation environments for iterative tuning and stability analysis prior to hardware testing
contributions: Architected MPPI and MPC-based control frameworks suited for real-time execution on fixed-wing UAVs
Defined systematic cost structures and parameter schedules for robust trajectory tracking
Performed preliminary simulation studies characterizing controller behavior under gusts and sensor noise
